newsitem.title: ISRAEL: RESEARCH ALERT-Lehman raises Nice EPS.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Lehman raises Nice EPS.

text.p: Lehman Brothers has raised its 1997 earnings estimate for Nice Systems Ltd, citing a strong first quarter by the Israeli computer telephony company.

Nice earned $0.28 a share in the first quarter against Lehman's consensus estimate of $0.26. Lehman, in a report released on Tuesday, upgraded its earnings per share (EPS) estimate for all of 1997 to $1.29 from $1.26. It also maintained its 1-Buy rating for Nice.

Lehman analyst Tim Luke said first quarter revenues for Nice, which produces computer telephony integration products and Comint systems, increased by more than 64 percent to $13.3 million, compared with Lehman's $12.5 million forecast.
Comint systems are used by military and government intelligence agencies to monitor and record transmissions from a variety of sources.

"We believe the increase in the quarter was partially attributable to increasing sales in a growing number of international markets," Lehman said, reiterating its 12-month price target of $30. Nice shares on Nasdaq are trading at $27.

"We consider that strong revenue and earnings momentum should allow the company's shares to trade at a premium to the voice processing group, or at least 25 times our revised 1997 estimate of $1.29," it said.
